Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lucifensin (Lucilia sericata Meigen defensin, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 3S=S; BBW)
Sequence Information.Source: gut, salivary glands, fat body, haemolymph; blowfly; maggots;Lucilia sericata

Literature Information.Literature:
First isolated from the gut of L sericata larvae. Also detected in salivary glands, fat body and haemolymph (provided by the authors). Active against M. luteus. Lucifensin adopts a characteristic insect defensin structure that
includes an alpha helix (residues 13-23) and a pair of beta-strands (residues 28-31 and 34-38) (Nygaard et al. 2012 J. Biomol. NMR 52: 277-282).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated 6/26/13; 2/2014.
Literature Information.Author: Cerovsky V, Zdárek J, Fucík V, Monincová L, Voburka Z, Bém R.2010
Literature Information.Title: Lucifensin, the long-sought antimicrobial factor of medicinal maggots of the blowfly Lucilia sericata
